Text: ['Mya-Rose Craig has been a committed “twitcher” and “birder” since she was a young girl (“twitching” involves the pursuit of a specific ornithological species, “birding” is casual spotting). Most weekends she is out in the countryside enjoying the wildlife. But last week the 18-year-old environmental activist, who is British-Bangladeshi, was spotted herself.', 'Her memoir, titled Birdgirl and the subject of a 14-way auction among British publishers, is rumoured to have sold for more than £250,000.', '“Writing about birds and the environment is something I’ve done for years, so I was amazed that there was so much interest,” she says. “But with everything that’s going on in the world right now, perhaps people really are rediscovering the beauty and necessity of the natural world.”', 'The']
Author: ['Michael Odell']

Text: ['A vicar who was selected as a Labour candidate at the last election but stood down when he was accused of sexual harassment has been sacked by the Church of England for adultery.', 'The Rev Steven Saxby, 49, who called himself the Red Rev, was nominated for the Cities of London and Westminster seat. He has now been removed from his role at St Barnabas Church in Walthamstow, east London.', 'In March last year Christine, his wife, said that she had discovered that he had an affair with an organist at the church in October 2018 and a four-year affair with an international pianist.', 'At the time she told the Daily Mail: “My husband of 20 years had an affair during October of last']
Author: ['Arthi Nachiappan']
Images_url: [['Steven Saxby with Talulah-Eve, a trans model, and Jeremy Corbyn', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F7e46a146-3022-11eb-8bd6-64d3c9126a9b.jpg?crop=1600%2C900%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]

Text: ['A German environmental foundation that has been given more than £17m by Gazprom, the Russian energy giant, has been accused of being a “puppet” funded by Moscow to circumvent American sanctions on the final stretch of a controversial pipeline carrying Russian natural gas to Germany.', 'The Climate and Environmental Protection Foundation was set up this month in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, the largely rural state in northeast Germany where the 764-mile Nord Stream II pipeline comes ashore.', 'It is the creation of Manuela Schwesig, the state’s Social Democratic premier, who is an ally of Gerhard Schröder, Germany’s former chancellor and chairman of Nord Stream II.', 'Schröder has been attacked by political opponents for his close relationship with Vladimir Putin, the Russian president, with whom he reached the Nord']
Author: ['Peter Conradi']
Images_url: [['A Russian pipe-laying vessel moored in north Germany alongside sections of the Nord Stream II pipeline', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Fsundaytimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F1c93333a-62fc-11eb-a89f-ac2e7b8b7ae3.jpg?crop=2667%2C1500%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]

Text: ['★★☆☆☆I’d better start by confessing that I’ve never much cared for the stories of Dr Seuss. He may be one of the patron saints of children’s literature in the US, but his relentlessly convoluted, wibbly-wobbly verse never appealed to me as a child. I hardly ever read his tales to my sons either.', 'So I’m not exactly the target audience for the Old Vic’s live-streamed revival of David Greig and Charlie Fink’s musical version of the ecologically conscious tale, first published 50 years ago, about an eccentric creature trying to save an idyllic landscape from the ravages of industrialism. Most reviewers, however, had kind words for the 2015 premiere. Indeed the Old Vic’s artistic director, Matthew Warchus, describes The Lorax as “one of the']
Author: ['Clive Davis']
Images_url: [['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/crossword-c7ae8934ef.png'], ['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/polygon-875ea55487.png'], ['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/sudoku-ee2aea0209.png'], ['Dr Seuss’s The Lorax', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F96ce066c-9ec4-11eb-8da6-6f8eecc82ac3.jpg?crop=1061%2C597%2C78%2C1&resize=360']]

Text: ['Joss Garman was one of the first to be arrested. Before dawn on a Monday in October 2007, the 22-year-old and 50 other environmental campaigners invaded Kingsnorth power station in Kent. Eon, which owned and operated the station, had applied for planning permission to build a coal-burning facility on the site — the first of a wave of new power stations planned for the country.', 'The strategy for the protest was simple: flood the site with so many activists that the security team could not halt them all, and shut down the station. “We stayed in a farmhouse in bunks the night before, got up at 3am and all got into minibuses,” Garman, now 35, recalls. “We climbed the fence and went through these dusty']
Author: ['Ben Spencer']
Images_url: [['From left: Alok Sharma; Isabella Tree; Sir David Attenborough; Rosamund Adoo-Kissi-Debrah; Chris Packham', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Fsundaytimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fae6ae1ec-c871-11eb-9261-5efb72cab90b.jpg?crop=1600%2C900%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]
